description.narrative: Illegal logging and trade in wood products, need for agricultural land and population pressure, large-scale land investments and high demand for wood based energy are causing huge pressure on the natural forests in East African countries. Due to weak natur al resources governance and law enforcement, lack of holistic information about forest resources and their threats and poor national and regional cooperation in forest trade the illegal logging and trade in forest products has become a serious problem. ##P rogramme will support government officials and institutions in different levels from local, to national and regional in five East African countries (Tanzania, Kenya, Mozambique, Uganda and Madagascar) to implement the Zanzibar declaration action plans to r educe illegal logging and trade in wood and forest products and to cooperate together to secure the valuable forest resources in the region. Programme will also support national civil society organizations to influence natural resources governance to becom e more responsible and transparent. In addition program will strengthen community based forestry approaches in all countries to bring benefits from sustainable community based forest management for the local communities. ##Beneficiaries: Government officia ls and institutions in the five countries, forest and community natural resource management forums and CSOs. Local communities with village forests in the five countries. ##Implementor: WWF country offices in Uganda, Tanzania, Kenya, Mozambique and Madagas car, WWF East Africa Regional Forest Programme. ##Cooperation partner: TRAFFIC (www.traffic.org)
